messages.subject: Low cost Sword
messages.msgSnippet: Hello to every one! Once again, I trying to buy a low cost ($300 / $500) sword to study, and practice polishing.. If any one have one to sell, please contact
messages.messageBody:
Hello to every one!
Once again, I trying to buy a low cost ($300 / $500) sword to study, and
practice polishing..
If any one have one to sell, please contact me privately at
maximo@...
Thank you in advance,
MÃ¡ximo

--

*
Maximo D. Marchionni*
Maximo@... <mailto:maximo@...>
www.maximom.com.ar <http://www.maximom.com.ar>




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
well done Dean, I posted it on my forum for others to see.

Great work

Rich

messages.messageBody:
Thanks, Rich and Dave. I've made some of the suggested improvements. I think you might enjoy other pages from Dad's website http://home.comcast.net/~colhartley/. These are not all complete; however, there is much that you might enjoy.

Dean

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: G day Dean, so it is save back out as a Jpeg, just using a different algorithm. XnView can be found here at http://www.xnview.com/en/index.html The first link
messages.messageBody:
G'day Dean, so it is save back out as a Jpeg, just using a different
algorithm.

XnView can be found here at http://www.xnview.com/en/index.html

The first link is the download (*XnView (v1.97.7/1.70)*
<http://www.xnview.com/en/xnview.html>)

Then using the second image (row of armour) as an example I just re
saved it with the default Jpeg settings (80%) and the file size went
from 2.8 meg to 480 K. Quite a difference. It is not as effective as
Photoshop but it's not bad, and I am sure the quality difference with be
almost non existent. Fiddling with the settings won't make a huge
difference.

Cheers

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: Rich, I m thinking about the XnView.  What do I do to reduce file size? Convert jpg to some other format? Dean Dr. Dean S. Hartley III Hartley Consulting 106
messages.messageBody:
Rich,

I'm thinking about the XnView. What do I do to reduce file size? Convert jpg to some other format?

Dean
Dr. Dean S. Hartley III
Hartley Consulting

106 Windsong Ln
Oak Ridge, TN 37830

(865) 425-9752
DSHartley3@...
http://DSHartley3.home.comcast.net

----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 09/12/2010 9:42 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show



Hi Dean, no mate, there are smart ways to reduce the file size of the
photos without compromising size or quality. Apps such as Photoshop
excel at this and also XnView which is free is a very good option. I
work in Film and Television so this is something I am quite experienced
in (as is Jim G our fearless leader)

I think there would be a good interest in the US and a lesser
international interest though selling any form of book to the younger
generation seems a daunting task. What do they need books for, they have
the internet.

Rich

On 13/09/2010 8:13 AM, Dean wrote:
>
> Richard,
>
> I presume you are suggesting downgrading the jpg photos to smaller

> Do you not have highspeed internet?
>
> I am thinking about reproducing the catalog, complete with Dad's notes
> and adding pages of the show pictures. Do you think there is a market
> for a paper copy (~$40)?
>
> Dean

messages.subject: Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Dean, I would use wordpress with a clear navigation and a picture gallery plugin to make the whole thing rather than making seperated html pages. Talk to
messages.messageBody:
Hi Dean,

I would use wordpress with a clear navigation and a picture gallery plugin to make the whole thing rather than making seperated html pages.

Talk to you,
Dave

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Dean" <dshartley3@...> wrote:
>
> I'm improving the Col Dean Hartley Website, specifically the page on the 1964 Barnsdall Sword Show put on by the Nanka Token Kai (http://home.comcast.net/~colhartley/Oriental/ArmsAndArmor.htm). I am looking for additional photos of the exhibit itself (the catalog pictures are already on the page). Fred Martin and Bob Haynes just about killed themselves putting on a fantastic show and I want it to remain possible for those who weren't there to enjoy it.
>

messages.subject: Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: Dave, What kind of structure are you thinking of?  I can probably do it in the current domain if I can understand how to build the html. Dean
messages.messageBody:
Dave,

What kind of structure are you thinking of? I can probably do it in the current domain if I can understand how to build the html.

Dean

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "lorrez_d" <lorrez_d@...> wrote:
>
> Amazing work you're doing there ! If you need a hand with structuring this thing, perhaps we can buy a new domain and put a nice structure into it so it's more easy to navigate ?
>
> Let me know if you need any help with this..
>
> And thanks for the effort you put into this project !
>
> Dave
>
> --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Dean" <dshartley3@> wrote:
> >
> > I'm improving the Col Dean Hartley Website, specifically the page on the 1964 Barnsdall Sword Show put on by the Nanka Token Kai (http://home.comcast.net/~colhartley/Oriental/ArmsAndArmor.htm). I am looking for additional photos of the exhibit itself (the catalog pictures are already on the page). Fred Martin and Bob Haynes just about killed themselves putting on a fantastic show and I want it to remain possible for those who weren't there to enjoy it.
> >
>

messages.subject: Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: Richard, I presume you are suggesting downgrading the jpg photos to smaller sizes.  I can do that; however, it does reduce the quality of detail.  Do you not
messages.messageBody:
Richard,

I presume you are suggesting downgrading the jpg photos to smaller sizes. I can do that; however, it does reduce the quality of detail. Do you not have highspeed internet?

I am thinking about reproducing the catalog, complete with Dad's notes and adding pages of the show pictures. Do you think there is a market for a paper copy (~$40)?

Dean


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi Dean, yes I agree, it's a brilliant job. One thing I would suggest is
> getting a little smarter with your photos as the page takes a long time
> to load. I down loaded one photo and it is 2.3 meg. Given that there are
> many images there it will slow down the loading considerably and also
> eat into peoples bandwith depending on their connection speeds.
>
> There are some easy ways to alleviate this and if you would like to
> discuss them please just let me know. I would be happy to help you.
>
> Cheers
>
> Richard Turner

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Dean, yes I agree, it s a brilliant job. One thing I would suggest is getting a little smarter with your photos as the page takes a long time to load. I
messages.messageBody:
Hi Dean, yes I agree, it's a brilliant job. One thing I would suggest is
getting a little smarter with your photos as the page takes a long time
to load. I down loaded one photo and it is 2.3 meg. Given that there are
many images there it will slow down the loading considerably and also
eat into peoples bandwith depending on their connection speeds.

There are some easy ways to alleviate this and if you would like to
discuss them please just let me know. I would be happy to help you.

Cheers

Richard Turner

messages.messageBody:
Amazing work you're doing there ! If you need a hand with structuring this thing, perhaps we can buy a new domain and put a nice structure into it so it's more easy to navigate ?

Let me know if you need any help with this..

And thanks for the effort you put into this project !

Dave

messages.subject: Photos from 1964 Sword Show
messages.msgSnippet: I m improving the Col Dean Hartley Website, specifically the page on the 1964 Barnsdall Sword Show put on by the Nanka Token Kai
messages.messageBody: I'm improving the Col Dean Hartley Website, specifically the page on the 1964 Barnsdall Sword Show put on by the Nanka Token Kai (http://home.comcast.net/~colhartley/Oriental/ArmsAndArmor.htm). I am looking for additional photos of the exhibit itself (the catalog pictures are already on the page). Fred Martin and Bob Haynes just about killed themselves putting on a fantastic show and I want it to remain possible for those who weren't there to enjoy it.
